content: notes on a dog jumper… i ve always wanted to make up a crocheted jumper for bertie to wear and i finally got around to it once i had something that fit him well and that he was happy to wear i knew i wanted to make more **please note** when using this pattern please be aware that there is no choice of sizes no tutorials or any of the usual extras and help that i would provide in one of my full patterns instead these are just the basic rough and untested notes that i made for my own use which i ve tidied up to share as requested but hopefully this will provide a starting point for you to begin your own experiments if you are looking to keep your dog cozy and warm **skill level** *intermediate* intermediate and foundation stitches used **note form only - not suitable for beginners** **yarn** approx 200 m / 219 yds of your choice of dk yarn around 170 m / 196 yds in the main colour plus smaller amounts in various colours for granny stripes and edging *i used…* stylecraft bambino 1 x clotted cream 7112 1 x denim dungarees 3943 1 x sage 7117 1 x soft pink 7113 sirdar snuggly cashmere merino silk 1 x beanstalk 308 **hook** 4mm g or size needed to match gauge **size** one size only - bertie s size he s a miniature dachshund **gauge** 17 sts x 10 row - 10cm 4 in treble_crochet us double_crochet **terms** uk and us #cherryheart #bertiesjumper
